meanings.sent1: The intumescence of the injured ankle was visible and painful.
meanings.sent2: The intumescence of the balloon made it difficult to tie.
meanings.sent3: The intumescence of the marshmallow caused it to burst out of the s'more.
meanings.sent4: The intumescence of emotions overwhelmed her heart.
meanings.sent5: The intumescence of the storm clouds signaled an impending downpour.

meanings.definition: The act of swelling or becoming enlarged
meanings.sent1: The rapid intumescence of the bread dough surprised the baker.
meanings.sent2: The intumescence of the river after heavy rain caused flooding.
meanings.sent3: The intumescence of the balloon was so sudden, it startled the children.
meanings.sent4: The intumescence of the music in the concert hall filled the air with energy.
meanings.sent5: The intumescence of the population in the city led to overcrowding.

meanings.definition: A swollen or enlarged part or area
meanings.sent1: The intumescence on the tree trunk indicated disease.
meanings.sent2: The intumescence on her cheek was a result of an allergic reaction.
meanings.sent3: The intumescence on the cake made it look like a mountain.
meanings.sent4: The intumescence on the horizon hinted at an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The intumescence on the map highlighted the mountain ranges.
